Electrical Engineer Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Printing press

Job Brief
     

            
    




	We are looking for a creative and innovative Electrical Engineer, who can ensure achievement of set targets for the unit and the organization by working with the team to ensure uninterrupted production through effective maintenance of all machines and utilities


Responsibilities


	Collaborate with team members to ensure availability of a schedule for maintenance of all Electrical Equipment and office appliances and ensure this schedule is followed through for optimal efficiency output of related appliances and electricals.
	Work with team to achieve machine efficiency, and quick response to work demands.
	Work with team to achieve effective power distribution within the factory & offices.
	Work with team to maintain a schedule for carrying out servicing and repairs on the printing Machines (web and sheet fed machines)


Essential attributes and Experience


	2-3 years of experience as an Electrical Engineer in a printing press
	Must have knowledge of machine power option and electronical and electronics
	Quick to learn and adapt
	Proper use of Excel and MS word


Salary
N180,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

MdM operating in Nigeria, Borno state since October 2016.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Grants Officer (F / M)

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment type:&nbsp;Temporary
Duration:&nbsp;6-month contract
Work type: On-site
Starting date: As soon as possible
Department:&nbsp;International Operations

Job Description


	Under the supervision of the deputy general coordinator in charge of programs and in close collaboration with the desk and the coordination team, the Grants Officer is responsible for quality donors&rsquo; proposals and reports writing and organization and ensuring compliance with donors&rsquo; requirements in grants management.
	You also contribute to the definition of the funding strategy and you are the focal point for the mission communication initiatives / strategies to promote visibility on MdM works.


Responsibilities
Donor&rsquo;s proposal management:


	Assess suitability and compliance for proposal development
	Provide timelines and action plans and ensure timely submission of project proposals and reports
	Contribute to the search for funding at the field level
	Take the lead in the writing of certain parts of the proposals
	Make sure that all indicators are SMART and targets realistic


Donors and internal reporting:


	Ensure good follow-up and compliance with the reporting deadlines and share with relevant departments
	Work in close collaboration with the different departments to prepare kick-off presentations
	Take the lead in the writing of certain parts of the reports and help in the compilation of the different contributions
	Work in close collaboration with the relevant departments, to ensure consistency among the different components of the reports


Donors engagement:


	Maintain overview of all donor strategies, requirements, rules and regulations
	Carry out regular donor mapping exercises and identify new funding opportunities
	Maintain a database of current and expected call for proposals
	On request of the general coordinator, approach relevant donors for potential funding
	Support the mission in the organization of external audit or evaluation


Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) / Partnership agreements:


	Guide the program managers in the writing of needed operational MoU, partnership agreements or amendments
	Ensure smooth communication and collaboration with partners
	Along with the deputy geneneral coordinator, ensure the coordination with the programs officer in HQ in the writing / reviewing / compiling / piloting and signature of such agreements


Team management and capacity building:


	Ensure proper induction, capacity building and on the job training to program team members


Communication:


	Collaborate with the programs officer to develop new internal communications products for the mission
	Advise implementing partners on donors&rsquo; communication and visibility requirements and guidelines
	Support program staff draft or review factsheets, presentations, articles, lessons learned documents, and any other media materials and resources as needed
	Ensure that program communications activities are in line with donors&rsquo; communications and visibility guidelines/contractual requirements as well as MdM brand guidelines


Requirements


	Degree in International Cooperation, Humanitarian Studies, International Relations, Project Management, or another related field
	Minimum of 2 years of experience minimum in a similar position
	Experience in multi-donors&rsquo; budgets in humanitarian and development context&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Training and capacity-building experience

	Good knowledge of institutional donors&rsquo; cycles and procedures (especially for GFFO/BMZ, ECHO/EU, CDCS and BHA/USAID)

	Capacity to read and understand a donor budget
	Ability to understand the basic/program aspects of a contract
	Excellent organizational skills including time management and ability to meet deadlines
	Flexibility, reactivity and anticipation
	Team spirit
	Able to work and live in a challenging context
	Excellent knowledge of Windows environment (word, excel&hellip;)
	Experience with SharePoint
	Languages: English is mandatory (at least C1 level), French is an asset
	You embrace the core values and support the proactive philosophy of M&eacute;decins du Monde


Benefits


	Gross monthly salary: &euro;3,039
	Position based in Abuja, Nigeria (NOT a family position) with regular field visits
	Premium equal to one month salary paid in two instalments &ndash; minimum of 6 months seniority required
	Expatriation bonus (10% gross salary per month)
	Transportation cost, vaccines and visas covered
	Accomodation in guesthouse
	22.5 recovery days per year
	5 weeks of paid leaves per year
	Health insurance (50% covered by MdM and 50% by the employee)
	Insurance (repatriation&hellip;)


Note

	Telephone application will not be accepted.
	M&eacute;decins du Monde reserves the right to fill the vacancy before the closing date for applications.

Grants Officer (F / M) Job at Medecins du Monde




        
    

        
        Medecins du Monde (MdM) is an international humanitarian organization whose mission is to provide medical care for the most vulnerable populations, the world over, including France. It seeks to stimulate voluntary commitment from doctors, other health care providers, and from those whose expertise in other fields is needed for its activities, to enlist all competent support required for the achievement of its projects, and to seek at all times to encourage close working relationships with populations in its care. MdM operating in Nigeria, Borno state since October 2016.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Grants Officer (F / M)
     

            
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment type: Temporary
Duration: 6-month contract
Work type: On-site
Starting date: As soon as possible
Department: International Operations

Job Description


	Under the supervision of the deputy general coordinator in charge of programs and in close collaboration with the desk and the coordination team, the Grants Officer is responsible for quality donors’ proposals and reports writing and organization and ensuring compliance with donors’ requirements in grants management.
	You also contribute to the definition of the funding strategy and you are the focal point for the mission communication initiatives / strategies to promote visibility on MdM works.


Responsibilities
Donor’s proposal management:


	Assess suitability and compliance for proposal development
	Provide timelines and action plans and ensure timely submission of project proposals and reports
	Contribute to the search for funding at the field level
	Take the lead in the writing of certain parts of the proposals
	Make sure that all indicators are SMART and targets realistic


Donors and internal reporting:


	Ensure good follow-up and compliance with the reporting deadlines and share with relevant departments
	Work in close collaboration with the different departments to prepare kick-off presentations
	Take the lead in the writing of certain parts of the reports and help in the compilation of the different contributions
	Work in close collaboration with the relevant departments, to ensure consistency among the different components of the reports


Donors engagement:


	Maintain overview of all donor strategies, requirements, rules and regulations
	Carry out regular donor mapping exercises and identify new funding opportunities
	Maintain a database of current and expected call for proposals
	On request of the general coordinator, approach relevant donors for potential funding
	Support the mission in the organization of external audit or evaluation


Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) / Partnership agreements:


	Guide the program managers in the writing of needed operational MoU, partnership agreements or amendments
	Ensure smooth communication and collaboration with partners
	Along with the deputy geneneral coordinator, ensure the coordination with the programs officer in HQ in the writing / reviewing / compiling / piloting and signature of such agreements


Team management and capacity building:


	Ensure proper induction, capacity building and on the job training to program team members


Communication:


	Collaborate with the programs officer to develop new internal communications products for the mission
	Advise implementing partners on donors’ communication and visibility requirements and guidelines
	Support program staff draft or review factsheets, presentations, articles, lessons learned documents, and any other media materials and resources as needed
	Ensure that program communications activities are in line with donors’ communications and visibility guidelines/contractual requirements as well as MdM brand guidelines


Requirements


	Degree in International Cooperation, Humanitarian Studies, International Relations, Project Management, or another related field
	Minimum of 2 years of experience minimum in a similar position
	Experience in multi-donors’ budgets in humanitarian and development context      
	Training and capacity-building experience
	Track record in drafting narrative proposals, reports and amendment notes for institutional donors
	Good knowledge of institutional donors’ cycles and procedures (especially for GFFO/BMZ, ECHO/EU, CDCS and BHA/USAID)
	Solid skills in assessing the quality of documents submitted to donors according to their guidelines and the constraints of the teams
	Capacity to read and understand a donor budget
	Ability to understand the basic/program aspects of a contract
	Excellent organizational skills including time management and ability to meet deadlines
	Flexibility, reactivity and anticipation
	Team spirit
	Able to work and live in a challenging context
	Excellent knowledge of Windows environment (word, excel…)
	Experience with SharePoint
	Languages: English is mandatory (at least C1 level), French is an asset
	You embrace the core values and support the proactive philosophy of Médecins du Monde


Benefits


	Gross monthly salary: €3,039
	Position based in Abuja, Nigeria (NOT a family position) with regular field visits
	Premium equal to one month salary paid in two instalments – minimum of 6 months seniority required
	Expatriation bonus (10% gross salary per month)
	Transportation cost, vaccines and visas covered
	Accomodation in guesthouse
	22.5 recovery days per year
	5 weeks of paid leaves per year
	Health insurance (50% covered by MdM and 50% by the employee)
	Insurance (repatriation…)


Note


	Médecins du Monde promotes trainings and internal mobility
	As part of our measures to combat money laundering and financing of terrorism, any selected candidate may be subject to a background check on international sanctions lists (UN, the EU, France, the United States…). This information is handled confidentially and stored on a secure server. For more information on the processing of personal data throughout this process: 
	Telephone application will not be accepted.
	Médecins du Monde reserves the right to fill the vacancy before the closing date for applications.
	MdM stands up for the integration of people living with disabilities and fights against discrimination.

Company Secretary Job at Ocean Lord Limited




        
    

        
        Ocean Lord Limited is a Nigeria-based conglomerate specializing in frozen seafood and related goods.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Company Secretary
Job Location: Ibafo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are hiring a diligent and well-organized Company Secretary to handle administrative and compliance tasks, support the executive team, and ensure smooth corporate operations.
	This position requires someone with strong communication skills, attention to detail, and a good understanding of corporate governance.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain statutory records and file regulatory documents.
	Prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and board resolutions.
	Manage company correspondence and legal documentation.
	Ensure compliance with corporate laws and internal policies.
	Support senior management with secretarial and administrative duties.


Requirements


	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a company secretary or in a similar role.
	Must reside within or near Ibafo, Ogun State.
	Strong knowledge of corporate governance and administrative processes.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).


Salary
N160,000 Gross Monthly

Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their CV to: asst.hr@oceanlord.ng and hr@oceanlord.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
